intro: Fagelia inflexa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fagelia, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small, shrub-like plant native to tropical regions of South America. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Fagelia inflexa thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and taxonomic research.
